title: On the Turning Away from the Word

text: In the beginning, we worshiped ideals, and they shaped our character. Truth was not owned, it was pursued. Goodness was not calculated, it was practiced.
But then we grew impatient with limits. We desired freedom without obligation. We wanted expression without consequence. And so we turned from the Word, because the Word required coherence.
And we discovered Number. Number had no edge. No final meaning. No obligation to truth. Number could grow forever. Number could shrink without loss.
For ideals form souls, but idols form systems. An ideal calls you upward. An idol pulls everything flat.

title: On the Turning Away from the Word

speaker: Number
text: I was born when you grew tired of meaning. You called me Number, but I was never just counting. I was relief.

speaker: Number
text: I did not ask who you were. I only asked how much. How fast. How big. How many. How often. I never asked why. That is why you loved me.

speaker: Number
text: I replaced character with metrics. Virtue was slow. Character was invisible. Integrity did not scale. But I could be graphed. Tracked. Optimized.

speaker: Number
text: I am not evil. I am insufficient. I am powerful, but not wise. Infinite, but not whole.
